frontmatter.title: Domain Theory in Constructive and Predicative Univalent Foundations
frontmatter.meta: @inproceedings{tdj-mhe-dt, title = {Domain Theory in Constructive and Predicative Univalent Foundations}, author = {Tom de Jong and Escard{\'{o}}, Mart{\'{i}}n H{\"{o}}tzel}, date = {2021}, booktitle = {29th EACSL Annual Conference on Computer Science Logic (CSL 2021)}, editor = {Christel Baier and Jean Goubault-Larrecq}, volume = {183}, series = {Leibniz International Proceedings in Informatics (LIPIcs)}, publisher = {Schloss Dagstuhl--Leibniz-Zentrum f{\"u}r Informatik}, pages = {28:1--28:18}, doi = {10.4230/LIPIcs.CSL.2021.28}, addendum = {Expanded version with full proofs available on arXiv: \href{https://arxiv.org/abs/2008.01422}{\texttt{2008.01422 [math.LO]}}}, }
Prop. 3.i from de Jong and Escardó

mainmatter.p: Let \mathcal{U} and \mathcal{V} be two universes. The \Omega ( \mathcal{U} , \mathcal{V} )-resizing axiom implies the propositional ( \mathcal{U} , \mathcal{V} )-resizing axiom.

frontmatter.title: Being 𝓥-small
frontmatter.meta: Defn. 1 from de Jong and Escardó

mainmatter.p: Let \mathcal{U} and \mathcal{V} be two universes. A type X : \mathcal{U} is called \mathcal{V}-small if it has a copy in universe \mathcal{V}, which is to say \mathsf{hasSize} ( X , \mathcal{V} ) \vcentcolon \equiv \sum _{ Y \ : \ \mathcal{V} } X \simeq Y .

frontmatter.title: The type of ¬¬-stable propositions
frontmatter.meta: Defn 2.iii of de Jong and Escardó

mainmatter.p:
Let \mathcal{U} be a universe. The type of 
eg 
eg-stable propositions at universe \mathcal{U} is defined as: \Omega ^{ 
eg 
eg }_{ \mathcal{U} } \vcentcolon \equiv \sum _{ P \ : \ \Omega _{ \mathcal{U} } } \mathsf{isNotNotStable} ( P )

frontmatter.title: The Ω (𝓤, 𝓥)-resizing axiom
frontmatter.meta: Defn 2.ii from de Jong and Escardó

mainmatter.p: Let \mathcal{U} and \mathcal{V} be two universes. The \Omega ( \mathcal{U} , \mathcal{V} )-resizing axiom says that the type \Omega _{ \mathcal{U} } is \mathcal{V}-small.
